meanings.definition: To drink something quickly and noisily.
meanings.sent1: She chugs her juice every morning before school.
meanings.sent2: He chugs his water after a long run.
meanings.sent3: The little girl chugs her milk, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The engine chugs along the tracks, just like she chugs her drink.
meanings.sent5: The thirsty dog chugs the water from its bowl eagerly.

meanings.definition: A series of short, explosive sounds.
meanings.sent1: The chugs of the old car could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: The train made loud chugs as it passed by.
meanings.sent3: The chugs of the fireworks startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The chugs of the popcorn machine signaled movie time.
meanings.sent5: The chugs of the steam engine echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: To move with a rhythmic, steady sound.
meanings.sent1: The boat chugs along the river, carrying its passengers.
meanings.sent2: The old truck chugs up the hill slowly.
meanings.sent3: The toy train chugs around the track in circles.
meanings.sent4: The coffee machine chugs as it brews a fresh pot.
meanings.sent5: The tractor chugs through the field, plowing the soil.
